summary:
Petrophysicist/geomechanicist with 33 years hands-on experience (28 years in petrophysics, 5 years in geomechanics) in various Shell companies across the world. I have persistently aimed to deliver technically high-quality fit-for-purpose products, thereby valuing honesty and integrity. Enjoy and experienced in coaching junior engineers of both western and non-western cultures.
Experienced user of petrophysics computing tools Techlog and IP, but flexible to use other packages (especially when user programming options are available). I aim to keep reports and presentations comprehensible for non-specialists as much as possible.
Since summer 2022 working regularly as an associate for Panterra Geoservices, providing petrophysical support for various geothermal projects.

profile_positions.description: - Since summer 2022 providing petrophysical support (via Panterra Geoservices) for various geothermal projects in the Netherlands, specifically (i) operational/drilling support and (ii) contributions to SDE reports (as part of the application for government subsidy for potential future projects). In the process frequently making use of IP software, and the Dutch NLOG database.
profile_positions.title: Consultant petrophysics and wellbore geomechanics

profile_positions.description:
- Member of the global Shell technical advisory panel for Techlog software development, focusing on the interface between petrophysics and wellbore geomechanics.
- Studied pore compressibility of a fractured carbonate reservoir, involving the use of tidal strain data.
- User testing wellbore stability software, and providing training for users.
- Providing petrophysical support in several equity redetermination projects.
profile_positions.title: Principal Petrophysicist

profile_positions.description:
- Geomechanics lead in Unconventionals department
- Developed in-situ stress workflows starting from routinely acquired logs to assist optimising horizontal well placement for hydraulic fracturing. Main calibrations were provided by (i) DFIT closure stress, and (ii) comparison of modelled vs. actual borehole breakouts and drilling-induced fractures interpreted from borehole image logs. 
- Carried out numerous DFIT interpretations with StimPlan software
- Put together the geomechanical part of the Shell internal "Petrophysics for Unconventionals" course.
profile_positions.title: Geomechanics specialist / Petrophysicist

profile_positions.description:
- Lead petrophysicist of the UK fields in NAM's offshore asset from March 2010 onwards, mainly involved in data acquisition planning of tight-gas infill wells in the Galleon field in the Sole Pit area of the Southern North Sea.
- Senior petrophysicist in NAM's land asset up to March 2010, responsible for planning and providing operational support for exploration and development wells, as well as analyzing reservoir monitoring logs (RSTs, PLTs)
- Coaching of junior petrophysicists in land and offshore assets.
profile_positions.title: Senior Petrophysicist

profile_positions.description:
- Lead petrophysicist for the Lunskoye gas field, the key field for the Sakhalin II LNG project.
- Participated in sand control study that resulted in major change of the lower completion of the big-bore gas wells. 
- Responsible for pore and fracture  pressure calculations of the platform development wells.
- Worked out, in close consultation with Shell's FEAST team, requirements and operational details of fluid sampling in both shallow gas investigation well and first big-bore gas well, thereby acquiring good knowledge of fit-for-purpose fluid sampling techniques (both downhole and at surface) with the suite of pressure/sampling tools present at the time.
profile_positions.title: Senior Petrophysicist

profile_positions.description:
- Senior petrophysicist for NAM's Land North asset. Responsible for all petrophysical issues in the asset from value creation (e.g. FDPs) to value realisation (production and reservoir monitoring). 
- Studied complex aeolian and fluvial sandstone reservoirs of the Rotliegend formation, with highly variable reservoir quality due to clay mineral diagenesis. Co-authored an AAPG poster on this subject. 
- Developed quantitative criteria to assess residual gas below the FWL phenomena via NMR technology. Presented paper (GG) on this issue at the 2004 SPWLA conference. 
- Supervision and coach of junior engineers, in VC and VR teams.
profile_positions.title: Senior Petrophysicist

profile_positions.description:
- Research focal point for NAM's surface subsidence team involving supervision of projects with Shell research, IKU Trondheim, and various universities in the Netherlands, France and the USA. Co-authored a paper on the IKU study of core damage effects. 
- Studied the influence of visco-elastic/plastic behaviour of Zechstein salt (overlying the gasbearing Rotliegend) on the surface subsidence due to reservoir compaction via finite-element-modelling.
profile_positions.title: Geomechanics engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Deputy team leader of the unitisation team preparing for the 1992 Troll field unitisation (operated by Norske Shell), having responsibility for the petrophysical model. The key elements of this petrophysical model were applied successfully during the follow-up unitisation in 1998. 
- Applied state-of-the-art resistivity modelling and deconvolution techniques (i.c. correction of induction logs for shoulder bed effects) to the Statfjord field resulting in a substantial increase in evaluated STOIIP.  
- Formed part of a multi-company team (Mobil, Esso, Statoil and Shell) carrying out the Norway vs. UK unitisation of the Statfjord field, working in both Statoil and Shell offices. Responsible for the petrophysical part of the work. 
- Often represented Norske Shell in technical committee meetings with partners on NOV fields.
profile_positions.title: Petrophysicist

profile_positions.description:
- Petrophysicist in special studies team (1987-1988). Applied the Shell-research-developed effective medium model to the evaluation of complex carbonate lithologies (i.c. Khuff carbonates containing mouldic porosity), using a combination of nuclear, di-electric, PNC, resistivity and sonic logs. 
- Lead petrophysicist responsible for Qarn Alam area (1988-1991).
- Evaluated first trial LWD resistivity logs by Sperry Sun. 
- Acquired expertise in pulsed-neutron capture logging (both in terms of formation evaluation and waterflow behind casing). 
- Responsible for coaching and development of local junior staff belonging to the North Oman development unit.
profile_positions.title: Petrophysicist

profile_positions.description:
- Developed statistical log analysis programs (multi-mineral analysis FLAME, and cluster analysis programs CLASS and CLUSTER) which remained available in Shell's petrophysical software package LOGIC up to 2007 (more or less equivalent programs are available in commercially available petrophysical software packages, e.g. TECHLOG, today). 
- Studied various shaly sand evaluation techniques. Worked on assessment of clay mineralogy and cation-exchange capacity from wireline logs (e.g. gamma ray spectroscopy). 
- Carried out formation strength studies for various operating units.
profile_positions.title: Research petrophysicist

profile_positions.description: - Part-time teacher of physics and mathematics at RSG Gouda (2nd and 3rd grade, 13-16 years old)
profile_positions.title: Secondary School Teacher
